description: landscape with brilliant blue body of water; pink and green foliage on hills beyond water; tall tree with white blossoms at front left; green trees and foliage, and blue, purple, white and pink foliage, in foreground; pale blue sky
text: Initially trained as an academic painter, Moret’s style evolved under the influence of Paul Gauguin and the Pont-Aven artists. The hatched brushstrokes of brilliant, pure color in The Cove of Goulineau evidence this influence. Gradually his landscape paintings became increasingly Impressionistic in their naturalism and concentration on transient light effects.
title: L'Anse du Goulineau
